info.description: The Management Web Api Api for managing resources

max_failed_access_attempts.description: Maximum Number of failed attempts a user account can have before the user is locked out. The specified value is inclusive of the count.

user_lockout_time_span.description: Lockout duration in minutes once a user account has been locked out.

ip_lockout_time_span.description: Lockout duration in minutes once an Ip address has been locked out.

allowed_ips.description: Whitelisted IP Addresses where the Account Protection does not trigger.

lockout_type.description: Types of Lockouts to enable per User Account

AccountProtectionUserLockoutOptions.description: The Account Protection UserLockout response class

enabled.description: Specifies if the resource is enabled.

name.description: The unique name of the resource. This is the value a client will use for the scope parameter in the authorize request.

description.description: A brief description about the Resource
description.example: Current position in the employed organization

show_in_discovery_document.description: Specifies whether this resource is shown in the discovery document.

user_claims.description: List of associated user claim types that should be included in the Access token.

creation_time.description: Specifies the creation time of the resource (in Epoch).

last_updated.description: Specifies the last update time of the resource (in Epoch).

api_secrets.description: The Api secret is used for the introspection endpoint. The API can authenticate with introspection using the API name and secret.

enabled.description: Specifies if the resource is enabled.

name.description: The unique name of the resource. This is the value a client will use for the scope parameter in the authorize request.

description.description: A brief description about the Resource
description.example: Current position in the employed organization

show_in_discovery_document.description: Specifies whether this resource is shown in the discovery document.

user_claims.description: List of associated user claim types that should be included in the Access token.

creation_time.description: Specifies the creation time of the resource (in Epoch).

last_updated.description: Specifies the last update time of the resource (in Epoch).

required.description: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen (if such a feature is implemented in the consent screen).

emphasize.description: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope (if such a feature is implemented in the consent screen). Use this setting for sensitive or important scopes.

BrandingEmailOptions.description: The Branding Email Options response class

background.description: Specifies the background css string to be used for pages

error_color.description: Specifies the error colour to be used for pages

favicon_uri.description: Specifies Uri used for the favicon

logo_uri.description: Specifies Uri used for the logo

primary_color.description: Specifies the primary colour to be used for pages

BrandingPageOptions.description: The Branding Page Options response class

BrandingProjectOptions.description: The Branding Project Options response class

BrandingSmsOptions.description: The Branding Sms Options response class

CertificateTypes.description:
* **chained** - Verifies the certificate with root CA and intermediary CAs
* **self_signed** - Verifies the self-signed certificate in the store against the certificate presented by the user
* **all** - Verifies both self-signed and chained certificates

type.description: Specifies the type of the claim

value.description: Specifies the value of the claim

value_type.description: Specifies the type of the claim value

secrets.description: List of Client secrets (only relevant for flows that require a secret)

require_client_secret.description: If set to false, no client secret is needed to request tokens at the token endpoint

description.description: A brief description of the client.
description.example: Deals with the preparation of financial statements, maintenance of general ledger, and more.

client_uri.description: URI for providing further information about client

require_consent.description: Specifies whether a consent screen is required to be shown

remember_consent.description: Specifies whether user can choose to store consent decisions

show_consent_scope_selection.description: Specifies whether or not the user is allowed to select the scopes on the consent screen

always_include_user_claims_in_id_token.description: When requesting both an id token and access token, should the user claims always be added to the id token instead of requiring the client to use the userinfo endpoint.

allowed_grant_types.description: Specifies the allowed grant types (legal combinations is required).

require_pkce.description: Specifies whether a proof key is required for authorization code based token requests

allow_plain_text_pkce.description: Specifies whether a proof key can be sent using plain method (not recommended to be set to `true`)

require_request_object.description: Specifies whether this client needs to wrap the authorize request parameters in a JWT

allow_access_tokens_via_browser.description: Controls whether access tokens are transmitted via the browser for this client. This can prevent accidental leakage of access tokens when multiple response types are allowed.

redirect_uris.description: Specifies allowed URIs to return tokens or authorization codes to

post_logout_redirect_uris.description: Specifies allowed URIs to redirect to after logout

front_channel_logout_uri.description: Specifies logout URI at client for HTTP front-channel based logout.

front_channel_logout_session_required.description: Specifies if the user's session id should be sent to the FrontChannelLogoutUri

back_channel_logout_uri.description: Specifies logout URI at client for HTTP back-channel based logout.

back_channel_logout_session_required.description: Specifies if the user's session id should be sent to the BackChannelLogoutUri

allow_offline_access.description: Specifies whether the client can request refresh tokens (by requesting the offline_access scope)

allowed_scopes.description: Specifies the scopes the client is allowed to access (by default a client has no access to any resources)

identity_token_lifetime.description: Lifetime of identity token in seconds

access_token_lifetime.description: Lifetime of access token in seconds

authorization_code_lifetime.description: Lifetime of authorization code in seconds

consent_lifetime.description: Lifetime of a user consent in seconds

absolute_refresh_token_lifetime.description: Maximum lifetime of a refresh token in seconds

sliding_refresh_token_lifetime.description: Sliding lifetime of a refresh token in seconds

refresh_token_usage.description: Specified the validity of a refresh token

update_access_token_claims_on_refresh.description: Specifies a value indicating whether the access token (and its claims) should be updated on a refresh token request

refresh_token_expiration.description: Specifies how the refresh token expires

access_token_type.description: Specifies whether the access token is a reference token or a self contained JWT token.

enable_local_login.description: Specifies whether the local login (Username / Password) is allowed for this client.

identity_provider_restrictions.description: Specifies which authentication providers can be used with this client (if list is empty all providers are allowed)

include_jwt_id.description: Specifies whether JWT access tokens should include an identifier

claims.description: Allows settings claims for the client (will be included in the access token).

always_send_client_claims.description: Specifies whether client claims should be always included in the access tokens - or only for client credentials flow.

client_claims_prefix.description: If set, the client claim will be prefixed with this value

allowed_cors_origins.description: The allowed CORS origins for JavaScript clients.

user_sso_lifetime.description: The maximum duration (in seconds) since the last time the user authenticated. You can adjust the lifetime of a session token to control when and how often a user is required to reenter credentials instead of being silently authenticated, when using a web application.

user_code_type.description: Specifies the type of code that will be generated for the device code flow

creation_time.description: Specifies the creation time of the client (in Epoch).

last_updated.description: Specifies the last update time of the client (in Epoch).

use_internal_keys.description: Use the the internal keys to send Emails

CommunicationEmailOptions.description: The Communication Email Options response class

CommunicationEmailSendGridOptions.description: The Communicaiton Email SendGrid Options response class

use_internal_keys.description: Use the the internal keys to send Sms

CommunicationSmsOptions.description: The Communication Sms Options response class

CommunicationSmsTwilioOptions.description: The Communication Sms Twilio Options response class

CreateClientRequest.description: The Create Client class models an OpenID Connect or OAuth 2.0 client - e.g. a native application, a web application or a JS-based application.

enabled.description: Specifies if the resource is enabled.

name.description: The unique name of the resource. This is the value a client will use for the scope parameter in the authorize request.

description.description: A brief description about the Resource
description.example: Current position in the employed organization

show_in_discovery_document.description: Specifies whether this resource is shown in the discovery document.

user_claims.description: List of associated user claim types that should be included in the Access token.

required.description: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen (if such a feature is implemented in the consent screen).

emphasize.description: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope (if such a feature is implemented in the consent screen). Use this setting for sensitive or important scopes.

CreateIdentityResourceRequest.description: The Create Identity Resource class models an OpenID Connect or OAuth 2.0 identity resource

expiration.description: The expiration date of the secret (in Epoch)

email.description: End-User's preferred e-mail address. Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax.

email_verified.description: "true" if the End-User's e-mail address has been verified; otherwise "false".

phone_number.description: End-User's preferred telephone number. E.164 (https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/e) is RECOMMENDED as the format of this Claim, for example, +1 (425) 555-1212 or +56 (2) 687 2400. If the phone number contains an extension, it is RECOMMENDED that the extension be represented using the RFC 3966 [RFC3966] extension syntax, for example, +1 (604) 555-1234;ext=5678.

phone_number_verified.description: True if the End-User's phone number has been verified; otherwise false. When this Claim Value is true, this means that the OP took affirmative steps to ensure that this phone number was controlled by the End-User at the time the verification was performed.

name.description: End-User's full name in displayable form including all name parts, possibly including titles and suffixes, ordered according to the End-User's locale and preferences.

given_name.description: Given name(s) or first name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple given names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

family_name.description: Surname(s) or last name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple family names or no family name; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

middle_name.description: Middle name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters. Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.

nick_name.description: Casual name of the End-User that may or may not be the same as the given_name. For instance, a nickname value of Mike might be returned alongside a given_name value of Michael.

picture.description: URL of the End-User's profile picture. This URL MUST refer to an image file (for example, a PNG, JPEG, or GIF image file), rather than to a Web page containing an image.

account_confirmed.description: Specifies whether the account has been confirmed.

DeviceFlowOptions.description: The Device Flow Options response class

subject.description: Specifies the text to be used as the email subject

template_uri.description: Specifies the URI for the custom template to be used

GenericBrandingEmailTemplateOptions.description: The Branding Email Generic Template Options response class

template.description: Custom LiquidJS template for the SMS

GenericBrandingSmsTemplateOptions.description: The Branding Generic Sms Template Options response class

enabled.description: Specifies if the resource is enabled.

name.description: The unique name of the resource. This is the value a client will use for the scope parameter in the authorize request.

description.description: A brief description about the Resource
description.example: Current position in the employed organization

show_in_discovery_document.description: Specifies whether this resource is shown in the discovery document.

user_claims.description: List of associated user claim types that should be included in the Access token.

creation_time.description: Specifies the creation time of the resource (in Epoch).

last_updated.description: Specifies the last update time of the resource (in Epoch).

required.description: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen (if such a feature is implemented in the consent screen).

emphasize.description: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope (if such a feature is implemented in the consent screen). Use this setting for sensitive or important scopes.

is_default.description: Specifies whether it's a built-in identity resource.

signing_algorithm.description: Specifies the type of algorithm used for signing.

is_current.description: Specifies whether the key is current default.

is_system_generated.description: Specifies whether the key is system generated or not.

use.description: Specifies the current use of the key.

original_use.description: Specifies the use for which the key was created.

creation_time.description: Specifies the creation time of the key (in Epoch).

valid_from.description: Specifies the time ( in Epoch ) from which the key is valid.

valid_to.description: Specifies the time ( in Epoch ) upto which the key is valid.

revocation_date.description: Specifies the revocation time of the key ( in Epoch ).

rotation_date.description: Specifies the time ( in Epoch ) at which the key was rotated.

KeyMaterialTypes.description:
Specifies the type of the key
* **x509**
* **jwk**
* **ecdsa**
* **rsa**

KeyMaterialUses.description:
Specifies the purpose / use of the key
* **signing** - The key can be used for signing new tokens.
* **validation** - The key can be used for validating the tokens.

LoginFlows.description:
* **username_password** - Both Username and Password (or password equvivalent) will be captured on the same screen if the Scheme supports it
* **username_first** - Username will be captured on the first screen and the Password (or equvivalent) will be captured on a different screen

consent_required_for_offline_access.description: Since access tokens have finite lifetimes, refresh tokens allow requesting new access tokens without user interaction. The clients need to be explicitly authorized by the User to request for refresh tokens. This option specifies if all the clients need Consent from the User for Offline Access.

allow_remember_me.description: Show RememberMe Checkbox on the Login Screen

primary_login_method.description: Primary Login Method to be shown on the Login screen. The value can be any one of the enabled Primary Login Method

secondary_login_methods_first.description: If enabled, Secondary Login Methods are shown on top and the Primary Login method is shown on bottom.

secondary_login_methods_order.description: Order of the Secondary Login methods buttons

login_flow.description: Specifies the Login Flow of the Primary Login method.

LoginPageOptions.description: The Login Page Options response class

automatic_redirect_after_sign_out.description: Specifies whether the user should be automatically redirected to the client specified URL after sign out.

show_logout_prompt.description: Specifies whether there should be a prompt before log out.

validate_certificate_use.description: If set to true, will validates whether the certificate is intended for authentication

validate_validity_period.description: If set to true, will verify the certificate's validity period

revocation_mode.description: Specifies the type of revocation check.

has_previous.description: Specfies whether there is a previous page

has_next.description: Specfies whether there is a next page

required_password_length.description: Specifies the minimum character length of password

require_non_alphanumeric_password.description: Specifies the whether a non alphanumeric password is required or not

require_digit_password.description: Specifies the whether a digit password is required or not.

require_lowercase_password.description: Specifies the whether a lowercase password is required or not

require_uppercase_password.description: Specifies the whether a uppercase password is required or not

required_unique_characters_in_password.description: Specifies the number of unique characters required in a password

PasswordStrengthOptions.description: The  Password Strength Options response class

PatchAccountProtectionOptionsRequest.description: The Patch Account Protection Options Request class

user_lockout_time_span.description: Lockout duration in minutes once a user account has been locked out.

ip_lockout_time_span.description: Lockout duration in minutes once an Ip address has been locked out.

allowed_ips.description: Whitelisted IP Addresses where the Account Protection does not trigger.

lockout_type.description: Types of Lockouts to enable per User Account

PatchAccountProtectionUserLockoutOptions.description: The Patch Account Protection User Lockout Options Request class

template_uri.description: Specifies the URI for the custom template to be used

PatchGenericBrandingCustomEmailOptionsRe.description: The Patch Generic Branding Custom Email Options Request class

template.description: Custom LiquidJS template for the SMS

PatchGenericBrandingCustomSmsOptionsRequ.description: The Patch Generic Branding Custom Sms Options Request class

enabled.description: Specifies if the resource is enabled.

name.description: The unique name of the resource. This is the value a client will use for the scope parameter in the authorize request.

description.description: A brief description about the Resource
description.example: Current position in the employed organization

show_in_discovery_document.description: Specifies whether this resource is shown in the discovery document.

user_claims.description: List of associated user claim types that should be included in the Access token.

required.description: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen (if such a feature is implemented in the consent screen).

emphasize.description: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope (if such a feature is implemented in the consent screen). Use this setting for sensitive or important scopes.

consent_required_for_offline_access.description: Since access tokens have finite lifetimes, refresh tokens allow requesting new access tokens without user interaction. The clients need to be explicitly authorized by the User to request for refresh tokens. This option specifies if all the clients need Consent from the User for Offline Access.

allow_remember_me.description: Show RememberMe Checkbox on the Login Screen

PatchLoginOptionsRequest.description: The Patch Login Options Request class

primary_login_method.description: Primary Login Method to be shown on the Login screen. The value can be any one of the enabled Primary Login Method

secondary_login_methods_first.description: If enabled, Secondary Login Methods are shown on top and the Primary Login method is shown on bottom.

secondary_login_methods_order.description: Order of the Secondary Login methods buttons

login_flow.description: Specifies the Login Flow of the Primary Login method.

PatchLoginPageOptionsRequest.description: The Patch Login Page Options Request class

automatic_redirect_after_sign_out.description: Specifies whether the user should be automatically redirected to the client specified URL after sign out.

show_logout_prompt.description: Specifies whether there should be a prompt before log out.

PatchLogoutOptionsRequest.description: The Patch Logout Options Request class

validate_certificate_use.description: If set to true, will validates whether the certificate is intended for authentication

validate_validity_period.description: If set to true, will verify the certificate's validity period

revocation_mode.description: Specifies the type of revocation check.

PatchMtlsOptionsRequest.description: The Patch Mtls Options Request class

required_password_length.description: Specifies the minimum character length of password

require_non_alphanumeric_password.description: Specifies the whether a non alphanumeric password is required or not

require_digit_password.description: Specifies the whether a digit password is required or not.

require_lowercase_password.description: Specifies the whether a lowercase password is required or not

require_uppercase_password.description: Specifies the whether a uppercase password is required or not

required_unique_characters_in_password.description: Specifies the number of unique characters required in a password

RefreshTokenExpirationTypes.description:
* **sliding** - When refreshing the token, the lifetime of the refresh token will be renewed (by the amount specified in "Sliding Refresh Token Lifetime" parameter). The lifetime will not exceed the time specified in the "Absolute Refresh Token Lifetime" parameter
* **absolute** - The refresh token will expire on a fixed point in time (specified by the "Absolute Refresh Token Lifetime" parameter)

RefreshTokenUsageTypes.description:
* **reuse** - The refresh token handle will stay the same when refreshing tokens
* **one_time_only** - The refresh token handle will be updated when refreshing tokens

* **no_check** - Will not check for revocation.
* **offline** - Will check for revocation against the customer generated revocation list
